definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: Don't speak in such abstract terms.
sentences.chinese: 不要這樣抽象地談問題。

sentences.english: Intents express abstract, high-level policy requirements.
sentences.chinese: 意圖表達抽象的高級策略需求。

sentences.english: With strong and thick bodies, the characters appear abstract and simple and their hands either stretch or clench.
sentences.chinese: 人物身條渾厚，手指若伸若握，抽象簡潔。

sentences.english: In the following practice, abstract art and figural art become a "convenient saying ".
sentences.chinese: 在今後的實踐中，“抽象和具象”就成了“方便說”。

sentences.english: One consequence of this approach was a requirement for support and development of the abstractions.
sentences.chinese: 這一方法的結果是出現了支持和開發抽象的需求。

sentences.english: Intuitively, we think in terms of abstraction.
sentences.chinese: 直觀地，我們從抽象方面進行思考。

sentences.english: There is something profound and yet minimalist about this advice.
sentences.chinese: 這個建議有其深刻性，及抽象性。

sentences.english: We formulate these broad thermodynamic laws.
sentences.chinese: 然後抽象這些一般的熱力學定律。

sentences.english: Examine both black-box and white-box views for each level of abstraction addressed.
sentences.chinese: 爲所描述的每個抽象層分析黑盒及白盒視圖。

sentences.english: They made this abstract sentimental experience vivid by depicting some images in their works.
sentences.chinese: 他們在創作中用形象將這種抽象情感體驗具象化。

sentences.english: The soundwave-like abstract patterns that Brauer has captured are stunning.
sentences.chinese: 布勞爾掌握的類似聲波抽象模式是令人驚歎的。

sentences.english: An abstract class is good as well.
We know it is abstract because it has no body.
sentences.chinese: 我們說它抽象是因爲它沒有方法主體。

sentences.english: Do you go for abstract paintings?
This class is an abstract base class for implementations which provide retrieval of unformatted data objects.
sentences.chinese: 一個抽象的基類，只提供獲取未格式化的原始數據。

definition: to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
